fine_dining.name: Casa Perbellini
signature_dishes: Spaghetti with smoked eel and apple
fine_dining.atmosphere: Intimate, elegant, with open kitchen viewing
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book far in advance. Request counter seating to watch Chef Giancarlo Perbellini and his team at work.
fine_dining.local_tips: Chef Perbellini is one of Italy's most respected chefs. The restaurant features an open kitchen concept where you can see all dishes being prepared.

fine_dining.name: Il Desco
signature_dishes: Tortelli filled with Monte Veronese cheese
fine_dining.atmosphere: Elegant, refined, located in a historic building
fine_dining.booking_tips: Book in advance. One of Verona's most established fine dining venues.
fine_dining.location: Via Dietro San Sebastiano (Near Piazza Bra)
fine_dining.local_tips: Long-standing Michelin-starred restaurant offering both traditional and innovative dishes with a strong emphasis on local products.

fine_dining.name: 12 Apostoli
signature_dishes: Pastissada de caval (horse meat stew, a Veronese specialty)
fine_dining.atmosphere: Historic, elegant, romantic, with Roman ruins in the cellar
fine_dining.booking_tips: Request to see the ancient Roman crypts in the cellar. Operating since 1750.
fine_dining.local_tips: One of Verona's oldest restaurants with incredible historical atmosphere. The wine cellar contains Roman ruins you can visit.

casual_dining.name: Osteria Sottocosta
casual_dining.booking_tips: Ask for recommendations on local wines to pair with the traditional dishes.
casual_dining.local_tips: Authentic local experience away from tourist crowds. Try the traditional Veronese dishes rarely found elsewhere.

casual_dining.name: Osteria Dogana Vecia
signature_dishes: Brasato all'Amarone (beef braised in Amarone wine)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Popular with locals. Good place to try authentic Veronese dishes at reasonable prices.
casual_dining.local_tips: Great selection of local wines from Valpolicella and Soave regions at fair prices.

casual_dining.name: Trattoria Al Pompiere
casual_dining.booking_tips: Centrally located and popular. Known especially for their meat and cheese selections.
casual_dining.local_tips: Start with their renowned cured meat and cheese selection. They age many meats and cheeses on-site.

casual_dining.name: Osteria Caffe Monte Baldo
signature_dishes: Pasta e fagioli (pasta and bean soup)
casual_dining.booking_tips: Go early. A true local experience with simple, quality food and wines by the glass.
casual_dining.local_tips: Perfect for a casual lunch or to experience the local aperitivo culture with small plates and wine.

street_food.name: La Passeggiata
street_food.local_tips: Great quality ingredients in their sandwiches. Perfect for a quick lunch while exploring.

street_food.name: Pizzeria Da Salvatore
specialties: Pizza al taglio (Pizza by the slice)
street_food.local_tips: Good quality pizza by the slice on Verona's main shopping street. Perfect for a quick bite.

street_food.name: Gelateria Savoia
street_food.local_tips: One of Verona's best gelaterias, in an ideal location for people-watching near the Arena.

coffee_shops.name: Caffè Borsari
must_try: Pandoro (in winter - Verona's traditional Christmas cake)
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Classic Italian cafe, elegant with outdoor seating
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Verona's older cafes, excellent for an authentic Italian coffee experience with quality pastries.

coffee_shops.name: Caffè Coloniale
coffee_shops.local_tips: Great location on Verona's most beautiful square. Good spot for people-watching and aperitivo.

coffee_shops.name: Pasticceria Flego
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Traditional pastry shop with cafe seating
coffee_shops.food_options: Excellent selection of pastries and cakes
coffee_shops.local_tips: One of Verona's best traditional pasticcerie. Great for breakfast or afternoon coffee and cake.

coffee_shops.name: Campidoglio Caffè
must_try: Wine by the glass (especially local Valpolicella)
coffee_shops.local_tips: Transforms from cafe to wine bar throughout the day. Good selection of local wines in the evening.

coffee_shops.name: Torrefazione Caffè Castorino
must_try: Freshly roasted beans to take home
coffee_shops.atmosphere: Tiny, authentic coffee shop focused on quality
coffee_shops.local_tips: For coffee aficionados. They roast their own beans and know their craft extremely well.

bars.name: Archivio
bars.atmosphere: Sophisticated, intimate wine bar in historic setting
bars.food_options: Quality cheese and meat platters, some small plates
bars.local_tips: Excellent selection of local wines with knowledgeable staff. Great introduction to Verona's wine regions.

bars.name: Antica Bottega del Vino
bars.food_options: Full restaurant menu featuring local specialties
bars.location: Via Scudo di Francia (Near Piazza Erbe)
bars.local_tips: One of Italy's most respected wine venues with an incredible cellar. A must for wine enthusiasts.

bars.name: Osteria del Bugiardo
bars.food_options: Excellent cured meats, cheeses, simple local dishes
bars.local_tips: Run by the Buglioni winery, offering their wines at very reasonable prices. Great for an authentic experience.

bars.name: The Soda Jerk
bars.local_tips: One of Verona's best cocktail bars with serious mixology. Different vibe from traditional Italian spots.

bars.name: Terzo Ponte
bars.local_tips: Beautiful spot for sunset drinks with views of the Adige River and the city. Popular with locals in summer.

food_tours.name: Verona Food & Wine Walking Tour
food_tours.focus: Veronese specialties, Wine, Traditional Food Shops
highlights: Tasting local cheeses and cured meats
Wine sampling, including Valpolicella and Soave
Visiting historic food shops and markets
food_tours.booking_tips: Book in advance, especially in high season. Morning tours often include market visits.

food_tours.name: Amarone Wine Tour
highlights: Visiting wineries in the Valpolicella region
Learning about the unique appassimento drying process
Tasting different styles of Amarone and Valpolicella wines
Often includes lunch at a winery
food_tours.booking_tips: Worth the splurge for wine lovers. Includes transportation outside the city to the vineyard area.

cooking_classes.name: Veronese Cooking Class
includes: Market visit (sometimes), ingredients, hands-on instruction, meal with wine
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Many classes include a visit to local markets for ingredients. Book at least a few days ahead.

cooking_classes.name: Risotto and Pasta Workshop
includes: Ingredients, hands-on instruction, tasting of prepared dishes, recipe booklet
cooking_classes.booking_tips: Good option for those short on time who want a focused experience. Several cooking schools offer this.

markets.name: Piazza Erbe Market
highlights: Historic setting in Verona's most famous square
markets.best_time: Morning for produce, any time for browsing
markets.local_tips: More touristy than a true local market, but has authentic produce vendors especially in the morning hours.

markets.name: Mercato dello Stadio
markets.local_tips: Much more authentic local market experience than the central Piazza Erbe. Worth the short trip from the center.

spring: White Asparagus ('Asparagi Bianchi' - particularly from Bassano del Grappa)
Vialone Nano Rice (for creamy spring risottos)
summer: Fresh Lake Fish (especially from Lake Garda)
autumn: Pumpkin ('Zucca' - for filled pasta and risotto)
winter: Pearà sauce (bread, beef marrow, black pepper sauce)
